titleInfo.title: Journal Second Provisional Regiment, Tennessee State Guard, March 1943, Riot Problem

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
mods.abstract: One sheet of typed paper containing the training schedule, special orders, and sick report of the Second Regiment of the Tennessee State Guard for their March 1943 maneuvers at Camp Forrest.

The journal indicates that the State Guard conducted drills to deal with potential riot problems. Camp Forrest operated as a major World War II training camp, hospital center, and maneuvers base from 1941 to 1946. Having been constructed east of Tullahoma and near the site of the old Camp Peay National Guard Camp, it occupied 85,000 acres, and eventually became a prisoner of war camp as well.
